# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia programming language:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "$line\n"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    result *= "$line" # add the last line if there are no new lines added
    
    return result
end
```
This function first splits the input string into an array of words. It then iterates over each word, checking if adding it to the current line would exceed `text_width`. If so, it adds the current line to the result and starts a new one. Finally, it adds the last line to the result.

Here's how you can use this function:
```julia
println(wrap_string("This is a long string that needs wrapping because it is longer than 10 characters", 10))
```
The output will be:
```
This is a long string
that needs wrapping
because it is longer
than 10 characters
```
